attributes.action: To Take Action in Protecting Children Going Back to School
attributes.additional_details: Currently the government is a key factor in terms of raising awareness and urging people to take action. By urging the government/parliament to take action, we can ensure that almost every person, if not all, is aware of the risks of coronavirus spreading within school and thus recognise the need to take action.
attributes.background: To recognise the fact that children are also at great risks of attracting the virus by going back to school, which meant that there will be a high chance of the virus spreading at a much quicker rate. We urge the government to make face masks compulsory to all students that are going back to school.

rejection.details:
You may be interested in the following petitions:

Keep schools closed until Covid 19 is no longer a threat: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316404

Make wearing face masks mandatory in secondary schools and colleges: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330227

Give All Schools Protective Equipment to help protect staff from the Coronavirus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306347
